modules.description: This module implements UDP client functionality for sending OSC packets over a network. It provides functions to create and destroy client instances, as well as to send packets to a specified socket address. It is used for transmitting Open Sound Control messages in real-time audio networking applications.

This module implements a UDP server for handling OSC packets. It provides functions to create and destroy a server instance, and to receive packets along with their source addresses. It is used for building networked audio applications that communicate using the Open Sound Control protocol over UDP.

This module provides UDP-based networking for Open Sound Control (OSC) communication, enabling both transmission and reception of OSC packets over a network. The client component allows creating instances to send packets to specified socket addresses, while the server component supports receiving packets along with their source information. Key operations include initializing and releasing client and server instances, sending OSC messages from a client, and capturing incoming OSC data on a server. For example, a client can send a timestamped audio event to a remote server, and a server can listen for and process OSC messages from multiple sources in real-time.

This module enables UDP-based Open Sound Control communication, supporting both sending and receiving OSC packets over a network. It provides client and server components for transmitting messages to specific socket addresses and capturing incoming data with source information. Key operations include initializing clients and servers, sending timestamped OSC messages, and processing real-time input from multiple sources. For example, a client can transmit audio events to a remote server, while a server can listen for and handle OSC messages from various senders.
